sub_topic: Calculation of vapor pressure of a substance
message_1: What is the vapor pressure of a sample of water when it is heated to a temperature of 100°C, assuming atmospheric pressure is 1 atm?
message_2: At 100°C, water boils and turns into vapor. The vapor pressure of water at this temperature is equal to the atmospheric pressure, which is given as 1 atm. Therefore, the vapor pressure of the water sample at 100°C is 1 atm.
